column2: MINNESOTA PERMIT TEST
column4: Minnesota

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Stop.
column8: Yield.

column2: 2. Which shape is a yield sign?
column4: Pentagon
column8: Upside-down triangle

column2: 3. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column8: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column10: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.

column2: 4. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: can not turn left.
column6: must go to the next intersection.
column8: must turn into its right lane.
column10: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: No Bicycle zone
column8: Bicycle repair shop ahead

column2: 6. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column8: watch for this species crossing the road.
column10: be ready to hit a reindeer.

column2: 7. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column8: Exercise.
column10: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 8. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: use your emergency or parking brake.
column6: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column8: pump your brakes.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: School crossing
column8: Mountain trail

column2: 10. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column8: Call an ambulance.
column10: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 11. An orange-colored sign means:
column4: School zone ahead
column8: You must change lanes ahead

column2: 12. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column6: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column8: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column10: take their foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 13. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column8: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.

column2: 14. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: look for a detour or another route.
column8: remove the sign and move forward.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 15. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: be aware possible hazards ahead.
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 16. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: do not enter
column8: stop

column2: 17. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: NO TURN ON RED.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 18. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column6: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.
column8: slow down before entering the curve.
column10: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.

column2: 19. The yield sign means:
column4: Stop if you can.
column6: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column8: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 20. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop.
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column8: leave more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 21. This sign means:
column4: No Passing Zone
column8: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 22. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column4: improves concentration.
column6: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column8: improve your driving performance.
column10: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 23. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 24. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must stop immediately.
column6: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column8: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column10: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 25. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column6: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column10: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.

column2: 26. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: share the lane with another vehicle.
column6: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column8: race on empty roads.
column10: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 27. Before backing up, you should:
column4: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.
column8: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column10: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 28. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column6: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column8: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column10: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 29. This warning sign:
column4: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.

column2: 30. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column6: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column8: on public roads
column10: within 250 feet of a traffic light.

column2: 31. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column8: must enter the roadway immediately.

column2: 32. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column4: decrease the following distance.
column6: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.
column8: increase the following distance.

column2: 33. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Warning signs (diamond)
column8: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 34. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Run away.
column8: Do not move.

column2: 35. This warning sign means:
column4: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children
column8: Watch out for children crossing the street

column2: 36. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrian crossing
column8: Low ground railroad crossing

column2: 37. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column6: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column8: increase your speed immediately.
column10: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.

column2: 38. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: low beam headlights.
column8: high beam headlights.

column2: 39. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column8: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column10: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 40. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Only if the light is green.
column8: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column10: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
